list.title: LT.init
list.description:
LT.init(itemsApp, options?)

  • itemsApp: Learnosity Items API instance (object, required)
  • options: { extensions?: string[] }

list.title: LT.init
list.description:
LT.init(authorApp, options?)

  • authorApp: Learnosity Author API instance (object, required)
  • options: { extensions?: string[], security?: object, request?: object }

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity
list.description: Everything relating to the activity currently loaded by Items API.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.activity
list.description: The activity configuration object, including anything overridden at runtime if using activity templates.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.activityId
list.description: The activity id used for this activity instance used to group related sessions.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.activitySubTitle
list.description: The visible subtitle from the configuration object.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.activityTags
list.description: All tags that have been set against items in the activity. Requires retrieve_tags to be set to true in the Items API configuration.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.activityTemplateId
list.description: The activity_template_id if templates are used. Returns '' if templates aren't being used.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.activityTitle
list.description: The visible title from the configuration object.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.adaptiveType
list.description: The adaptive type as defined in the configuration. Returns '' if the activity isn't adaptive.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.annotationsConfig
list.description: The annotations configuration object.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.autoSaveConfig
list.description: The auto-save configuration object. Returns true or an object based on what was in the configuration.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.elapsedTime
list.description: The current elapsed time for the session. Returns whether the timer is visible or not.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.hasActivityTemplate
list.description: Whether this activity was loaded from an activity template.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.hasAnnotations
list.description: Whether annotations have been configured with this activity.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.hasAnswerMasking
list.description: Whether this activity contains answer masking enabled.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.hasAutoSave
list.description: Whether auto-save is configured with this activity.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.hasEvents
list.description: Whether events have been configured with this activity.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.hasItemPool
list.description: Whether an item pool has been configured with this activity.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.hasLineReader
list.description: Whether this activity contains the line reader at the player level.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.hasReadingMode
list.description: Whether reading_mode was configured with this activity.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.hasResourceItems
list.description: Whether this activity contains resource item(s).

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.hasSections
list.description: Whether this activity contains sections.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.hasShuffledItems
list.description: Whether items have been shuffled within this activity.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.hasTryAgain
list.description: Whether the activity has try again enabled.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.isAdaptive
list.description: Whether this activity is adaptive.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.isResuming
list.description: Whether the user is resuming the session.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.isVerticalLayout
list.description: Whether the activity is rendered using the vertical layout. In which case, things like items.item() are not available.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.itemBank
list.description: The global organisation_id used for this activity instance.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.itemPool
list.description: The item_pool_id used for this activity instance.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.maxTime
list.description: The maximum time allowed for this session. If 0, it means unlimited time.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.region
list.description:
Which UI region the session was set up with. Values include:

  • main
  • horizontal
  • horizontal-fixed

undefined will mean that no regions key was found in the Items API configuration, meaning the player defaults to the legacy UI region (not recommended).

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.resourceItems
list.description: The resource item references used for this activity instance.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.sessionId
list.description: The session_id used for this activity instance.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.state
list.description:
The current state of this activity instance. Possible values:

  • initial
  • resume
  • review
  • preview

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.timeRemaining
list.description: The time remaining in the session. If max_time hasn't been set, the session is unlimited, so this returns null.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.totalItems
list.description: The total number of items in the activity, including items within sections if relevant.

list.title: module:Assessment/Activity.userId
list.description: The user_id as defined in the configuration.

list.title: module:Assessment/App
list.description: Learnosity Toolkit app module.

list.title: module:Assessment/App.annotationsApp
list.description: The Annotations API app instance, or null if not loaded.

list.title: module:Assessment/App.assessApp
list.description: The Assess API app instance, or null if not loaded.

list.title: module:Assessment/App.eventsApp
list.description: The Events API app instance, or null if not loaded.

list.title: module:Assessment/App.itemsApp
list.description: Returns the Items API app instance that the host page declared.

list.title: module:Assessment/App.questionsApp
list.description: The Questions API app instance, or null if not loaded.

list.title: module:Assessment/Diagnostics
list.description: Diagnostic/metadata information for Items API.

list.title: module:Assessment/Diagnostics.diagnostics
list.description: Returns an object of diagnostic information about the current session.

list.title: module:Assessment/Diagnostics.filterEvent
list.description:
Which event(s) you want to listen for on the console. You must call listen() first to start broadcasting.

Pass any of the following:

  • exact event (https://reference.learnosity.com/items-api/events) or;
  • '*' for all events or;
  • left or right wildcards via *

list.title: module:Assessment/Diagnostics.listen
list.description: Enables or disabled any console logging of events. Defaults to true, turn off by passing a falsy.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items
list.description: Everything relating to the items in the activity.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.dynamic
list.description: The dynamic object for the current item. Useful when using dynamic content with try again. https://reference.learnosity.com/items-api/methods/item/dynamic

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.flag
list.description: Toggles the user_flagged state on the current item.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.isDynamicItem
list.description: Whether the current item has dynamic content.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.isFirstItem
list.description: Whether the current item is the first item in the activity. This ignores sections, so will be a global check.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.isFlagged
list.description: Whether the current item has been flagged by the user.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.isItemFullyAttempted
list.description: Checks whether the entire item has been fully attempted. Returns false if all possible responses haven't been attempted (eg on cloze types). Handles multi-part items.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.isLastItem
list.description: Whether the current item is the last item in the activity. This ignores sections, so will be a global check.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.isMaskingEnabled
list.description: Whether the current item has answer masking enabled.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.item
list.description: JSON object for the current item.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.itemAttemptStatus
list.description:
Whether the current item has been attempted. Return value can be:

  • not_attempted
  • fully_attempted
  • partially_attempted

Partially attempted items may be where there are 2+ questions on the item and only 1 has been attempted.

Note that if a question accepts multiple responses, eg multiple dropdown elements, this method will return fully_attempted even if not all responses have been attempted. If you want to check all responses have been attempted use isItemFullyAttempted().

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.itemByResponseId
list.description: Returns an item object by response id.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.itemElement
list.description: The current item DOM element.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.itemPosition
list.description: The current item position, 1-based (not 0-based), in the activity. This ignores sections, so returns the global item position.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.itemReference
list.description: The reference of the current item.

list.title: module:Assessment/Items.itemTags
list.description: All tags that have been set against the current item. Requires retrieve_tags to be set to true in the Items API configuration.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player
list.description: Everything relating to the assessment player.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.answerMasking
list.description: Shows or hides the player answer masking tool. Answer masking has to be enabled in Items API configuration for this to work.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.dialog
list.description: Renders an Items API custom dialog.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.hideDialog
list.description: Hides a custom dialog.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.isFullscreen
list.description: Checks whether the player is in fullscreen mode.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.isIntroScreen
list.description: Checks whether the player is on the intro item.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.isReadingMode
list.description: Checks whether the player is in reading mode.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.isResponsiveMode
list.description: Checks whether the player is in responsive mode. This will be either the small or medium breakpoints. See more https://help.learnosity.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000758337-Customizing-the-Assessment-Player-experience-with-User-Interface-Regions#responsive-behavior

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.isReviewScreen
list.description: Check that the review screen has been loaded.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.lineReader
list.description: Shows or hides the player line reader. The line reader has to be enabled in Items API configuration for this to work.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.navigate
list.description:
Generic function to call API navigation methods. Supports:

  • previous
  • next
  • review
  • submit
  • Number (0-based) representing the item index

Internally this calls next(), previous(), review(), or goto() and submit().

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.next
list.description: Navigates to the next item. No-op if on the last item.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.previous
list.description: Navigates to the previous item. No-op if on item #1.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.review
list.description: Toggles the review screen.

list.title: module:Assessment/Player.submit
list.description: Submits the session.

list.title: module:Assessment/Questions
list.description: Everything relating to questions currently loaded by Items API.

list.title: module:Assessment/Questions.hasCheckAnswer
list.description: Checks whether the "Check Answer" button is enabled for the current question, including if enabled via activity override.

list.title: module:Assessment/Questions.isAutoScorable
list.description: Checks whether the question is auto-scorable. This includes questions that are technically auto-scorable but don't have a validation object set (including when the validation is ignored in Items API configuration).

list.title: module:Assessment/Questions.question
list.description:
Returns the question JSON on the current item.

If the item is multi-part, pass response_id to return the desired question. This argument will also look across all items for the requested response_id.

Returns {} if no question was found on the current item.

list.title: module:Assessment/Questions.questionInstance
list.description:
Returns the question app instance on the current item.

If the item is multi-part, pass response_id to return the desired question.

list.title: module:Assessment/Questions.questionResponse
list.description:
A response object for a question on the current item. Defaults to the first question.

Pass response_id if you want a different question response returned in the case of a multi-part item.

Returns {} if no questions found on the item.

list.title: module:Assessment/Questions.questionResponseIds
list.description: Array of response_id string values for all questions on the current item.

list.title: module:Assessment/Questions.questionScore
list.description:
The score object for a question on the current item. Defaults to the first question.

Pass response_id if you want a different question response returned in the case of a multi-part item.

Returns {} if no questions found on the item, or a non-autoscoreable question.

list.title: module:Assessment/Questions.questions
list.description:
Returns all question JSON on the current item.

Returns [] if no questions were found.

list.title: module:Assessment/Sections
list.description: Everything relating to any sections defined in the activity.

list.title: module:Assessment/Sections.isFirstItemInSection
list.description: Whether the current item is the first in this section.

list.title: module:Assessment/Sections.isLastItemInSection
list.description: Whether the current item is the last in this section.

list.title: module:Assessment/Sections.section
list.description:
The current section of the activity.

Returns {} if sections aren't being used.

list.title: module:Assessment/Sections.sectionHasShuffledItems
list.description: Whether items have been shuffled within this section.

list.title: module:Assessment/Sections.sectionIndex
list.description:
The index of the current section, 1-based.

Returns 0 if sections aren't being used.

list.title: module:Assessment/Sections.sectionItemPosition
list.description:
The item position in the current section.

Returns -1 if the activity isn't using sections.

list.title: module:Assessment/Sections.sections
list.description:
An array of section objects.

Returns [] if sections aren't being used.

list.title: module:Assessment/Sections.totalItemsInSection
list.description:
The total number of items in the current section.

Returns -1 if sections aren't being used.

list.title: module:Authoring/App
list.description: Learnosity Toolkit constructor module.

list.title: module:Authoring/App.authorApp
list.description: Returns the Author API app instance that the host page declared.

list.title: module:Authoring/App.questionEditorApp
list.description: The Question Editor API app instance, or null if not loaded.

list.title: module:Authoring/Diagnostics
list.description: Diagnostic/metadata information for Author API.

list.title: module:Authoring/Diagnostics.diagnostics
list.description: Returns an object of diagnostic information about the current app instance.

list.title: module:Authoring/Diagnostics.filterEvent
list.description:
Which event(s) you want to listen for on the console. You must call listen() first to start broadcasting.

Pass any of the following:

  • exact event (https://reference.learnosity.com/author-api/events) or;
  • * for all events or;
  • left or right wildcards via *

list.title: module:Authoring/Diagnostics.listen
list.description: Enables or disabled any console logging of events. Defaults to true, turn off by passing a falsy.

list.title: module:Authoring/Navigation
list.description: Everything relating to navigating Author API.

list.title: module:Authoring/Navigation.routingHash
list.description: Injects a route hash to the URI so SPAs can load to a deep view from a full page refresh.

list.title: module:Authoring/Widgets
list.description: Everything relating to a widget being created/edited.

list.title: module:Authoring/Widgets.type
list.description: The type of widget currently being edited. Returns undefined if not on the widget edit screen.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/ariaCountOnNav
list.description:
Appends of {totalItems} to the aria-label for the previous and next buttons.

Does not work for adaptive sessions (including branching) or sections.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/blockGrammarChecks
list.description:
This script blocks the Grammarly plugin and browser spellcheck, autocorrect, autocapitalize and autocomplete for:

  • Plain text and Essay question types
  • Annotations API notepad and sticky notes

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/blueLightFilter
list.description: Adds a semi-transparent overlay on top of the entire page. This is for users who have sensitivity to bright light, high contrast, or blue light.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/blueLightFilter~hide
list.description: Hides the blue light filter if it is currently visible. If the filter is already hidden, it does nothing.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/blueLightFilter~show
list.description: Shows the blue light filter if it is currently hidden. If the filter is already visible, it does nothing.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/blueLightFilter~toggle
list.description: Shows or hides the blue light filter. Returns true if the blue light filter is currently visible, false otherwise.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/checkAnswerValidation
list.description:
This extension is used in scenarios where you want the user to attempt all questions, and check the answer, prior to navigating to the next question.

Autoscorable questions that have disabled auto scoring will be ignored.

Items API configuration overrides take precedence:

{
    "config": {
        "questions_api_init_options": {
            "attribute_overrides": {
                "instant_feedback": false
            }
        }
    }
}

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/columnResizer
list.description:
Adds a UI divider in between the left and right columns (for items with 2 columns) providing the ability for the end user to resize the layout by dragging the element left or right.

The tooltip provides instructions on how to use the resizer. The resizer is not available for the horizontal-fixed region.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/contentTabs
list.description:
Renders styles and responsive logic for LT content tabs.

Pass in a theme option to change the look of the tabs.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/disableOnValidate
list.description: This extension is used to disable the question after it has been validated using the "Check Answer" button.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/essayLimitByCharacter
list.description:
This script changes the essay validation check on string length to be character based, instead of the default word based.

It ignores spaces by default, so they are not treated as characters to validate length.

Works with longtextV2 and plaintext question types.

Looks for relevent question types and overrides validation to be on character length. Uses the max_length (Word limit) that was set up in authoring, treating the value as a character length instead of word length.

Known limitations

If the assessment player is in responsive mode (< 800px) and you don't have the review screen enabled (which it is by default) then we can't inject a custom button. This means we render the default Finish button, and no prevent submission will occur. The solution is to use any of the valid regions (main, horizontal, or horizontal-fixed) and don't decouple the submit button from the review button in Items API configuration.

Essentially, if you're using default options, you'll be fine.

If submitting via the JavaScript submit() method, this will skip the validation check.

Preventing submission

By default, questions are authored to prevent the user from submitting their session in the event of word limit violations. The same behaviour is inherited in this extension. If you don't want to prevent submission, you can check the Submit over limit option in the question authoring area.

To prevent submission, we need to add a custom button to Items API becuase we can't easily inject a validation check when the default submit button is clicked, so we need to replace it with a custom one.

Adding a custom button is a capability in Items API. Below is a code snippet of an Items API configuration object. Note the custom button is added in region_overrides.

You MUST use the icon_class and name as defined in the custom button options object below.

main region

{
    "config": {
        "regions": "main",
        "region_overrides": {
            "bottom-right": [
                {
                    "type": "custom_button",
                    "options": {
                        "name": "btn-essay-character-limit-submit",
                        "label": "Finish",
                        "icon_class": "item-next hidden"
                    },
                    "position": "right"
                },
                {
                    "type": "next_button",
                    "position": "right"
                },
                {
                    "type": "previous_button",
                    "position": "right"
                }
            ]
        }
    }
}

horizontal or horizontal-fixed regions

{
    "config": {
        "regions": "horizontal",
        "region_overrides": {
            "bottom": [
                {
                    "type": "custom_button",
                    "options": {
                        "name": "btn-essay-character-limit-submit",
                        "label": "Finish",
                        "icon_class": "item-next hidden"
                    },
                    "position": "right"
                },
                {
                    "type": "next_button",
                    "position": "right"
                },
                {
                    "type": "horizontaltoc_element",
                    "position": "right"
                },
                {
                    "type": "previous_button",
                    "position": "right"
                }
            ]
        }
    }
}

Changing labels

This extension will automatically change Word Limit to Character Limit in the footer of the essay question types. However, for full coverage in review mode, or in authoring and reporting, you should use label bundles. Eg:

Assessment label bundle

Use this in Items and Reports APIs.

Caveat: this will update Math Essay and Chemistry Essay footers as well.

{
    "config": {
        "questions_api_init_options": {
            "labelBundle": {
                "wordLength": "Character Limit"
            }
        }
    }
}

Authoring label bundle

Use this in Author API.

{
    "config": {
        "dependencies": {
            "question_editor_api": {
                "init_options": {
                    "label_bundle": {
                        "help.longtextV2.name:max_length": "Character limit",
                        "help.longtextV2.name:show_word_limit": "Character limit",
                        "help.longtextV2.description:max_length": "Maximum number of characters that can be entered in the text entry area (max 10,000 characters).",
                        "help.longtextV2.description:show_word_limit": "Defines whether the character limit should be displayed in the toolbar or not. The options are: <ul><li><strong>Always On</strong> - Character Limit is always displayed.</li><li><strong>On Limit</strong> - Character Limit will only be displayed when the limit is reached.</li><li><strong>Off</strong> - Character Limit will not be displayed.</li></ul>",
                        "help.longtextV2.description:submit_over_limit": "Determines if the user can save/submit text when the character limit has been exceeded.",
                        "longtextV2:max_length": "Character limit",
                        "longtextV2:show_word_count": "Show character count",
                        "longtextV2:show_word_limit": "Character limit",
                        "help.plaintext.name:max_length": "Character limit",
                        "help.plaintext.name:show_word_limit": "Character limit",
                        "help.plaintext.description:max_length": "Maximum number of characters that can be entered in the text entry area (max 10,000 characters).",
                        "help.plaintext.description:show_word_limit": "Defines whether the character limit should be displayed in the toolbar or not. The options are: <ul><li><strong>Always On</strong> - Character Limit is always displayed.</li><li><strong>On Limit</strong> - Character Limit will only be displayed when the limit is reached.</li><li><strong>Off</strong> - Character Limit will not be displayed.</li></ul>",
	                    "plaintext:max_length": "Character limit",
                        "plaintext:show_word_limit": "Character limit"
                    }
                }
            },
            "questions_api": {
                "init_options": {
                    "labelBundle": {
                        "wordLength": "Character Limit"
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/events
list.description: Tracks user activity and events within Items API. JSON events are stored in an events object and can be rendered for analysis. Use the getEvents() method to retrieve and store the event log.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/events~getEvents
list.description: Gets the current event log, including environment state.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/hideAlternatives
list.description: Hides a number of MCQ distractors/alternatives, that aren't the correct answer, as an accommodation capability for students wanting to avoid cognitive load.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/keyboardShortcuts
list.description:
Enables keyboard shortcuts to perform an action against a question or on the assessment player.

Supports:

  • setting an MCQ response on items with a single MC questions, not multi-part.
  • enabling answer masking mode.
  • setting a mask on MCQ possible responses.
  • toggle flagging of an item.

All listeners will fire when you call run(). Pass a custom map if you want to remove any shortcuts.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/magnifier
list.description:
Allows the end-user to launch a magnifier to move around the screen and zoom in on whatever content they move it on top of.

TODO:

  • make movable via keyboard

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/magnifier~hide
list.description: Hides the magnifier if it is currently visible. If the magnifier is already hidden, it does nothing.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/magnifier~setupButtons
list.description: Sets up listeners on custom buttons to toggle the magnifier.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/magnifier~show
list.description: Shows the magnifier if it is currently hidden. If the magnifier is already visible, it does nothing.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/magnifier~toggle
list.description: Toggle visibility of the magnifier.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/mcqLabelPrefix
list.description:
Adds a prefix to all multiple-choice labels (correct answer and distractors).

Ignores block UI and radio button under option.

Supports

  • multi-select MCQs
  • shuffle responses
  • columns

Sets up an item load listener to add a prefix to all MCQ possible response labels.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/networkStatus
list.description:
Checks for an active network connection. If none found, adds an icon to the UI to indicate the status to the end user.

Can also be used to check the current download speed.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/networkStatus~checkConnection
list.description: Checks for network connectivity using a HEAD request. The return promise resolves to true if the request is successful, false otherwise.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/networkStatus~checkSpeed
list.description: Checks the current download speed using the Network Information API. Returns the current download speed in Mbps or a message indicating that the API is not supported. Eg 10 Mbps.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/readingMask
list.description: Renders a reading mask that helps users focus on specific parts of the content. The reading mask is a semi-transparent overlay that highlights the area around the mouse cursor, allowing users to read text more easily without distractions. It can be toggled on and off, and it updates its position based on mouse movements

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/readingMask~hide
list.description: Hides the reading mask if it is currently visible. If the mask is already hidden, it does nothing.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/readingMask~show
list.description: Shows the reading mask if it is currently hidden. If the mask is already visible, it does nothing.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/readingMask~toggle
list.description: Shows or hides the reading mask. Returns true if the reading mask is currently visible, false otherwise.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/renderPDF
list.description:
Renders any PDF uploaded as a resource to any item in the activity. Uses the native webviewer that has a toolbar to zoom, view thumbnails, and download etc.

By enabling this extension, all PDFs will be rendered in the viewer.

DEVELOPER NOTE: This extension may not render PDFs if the Chrome devtools are open. This is a known issue.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/resetResponse
list.description:
Resets a question by clearing (resetting) the UI and setting the attempted status to false.

Supports all question types, however we set to multiple choice (mcq) by default. If you want all types, pass ['*'] as the second argument. If you want a subset, pass an array of type alias' as the second argument. See the type property for each type here https://reference.learnosity.com/questions-api/questiontypes

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/resources/periodicTable
list.description: Renders the periodic table of elements as HTML, either in a dialog or a new tab.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/themes/canvas
list.description:
This script loads a custom UI theme for Items API.

Canvas is a minimal theme based on the Canvas LMS New Quizzes look and feel.

Items are vertically stacked with a flag button for each item. Because the assessment player is still present, you can have a timed test, auto-save, and other features.

Use the following custom region configuration in Items API to load this theme:

{
    "config": {
        "title": "Assessment title",
        "subtitle": "Assessment subtitle",
        "regions": {
            "items": [
                {
                    "type": "vertical_element",
                    "vertical_stretch_option": false,
                    "scrollable_option": false
                }
            ],
            "top-left": [
                {
                    "type": "title_element"
                }
            ],
            "bottom-right": [
                {
                    "type": "submit_button"
                }
            ]
        },
        "configuration": {
            "question_indexing": true,
            "accessibility": {
                "headings": {
                    "question": false
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/themes/juniorQuest
list.description:
Extensions add specific functionality to Items API. They rely on modules within LT being available.

--

This script loads a custom UI theme for Items API.

Use the following custom region configuration to load this theme:

{
    "config": {
        "regions": {
            "bottom-left": [
                {
                    "type": "previous_button",
                    "show_label_option": true
                }
            ],
            "bottom-right": [
                {
                    "type": "next_button"
                }
            ],
            "items": [
                {
                    "type": "items_progress_element",
                    "shown": false
                },
                {
                    "type": "slider_element"
                }
            ],
            "right": [
                {
                    "type": "verticaltoc_element"
                }
            ],
            "top-left": [
                {
                    "type": "title_element"
                }
            ]
        }
    }
}

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/themes/nextGen~run
list.description: Loads the nextGen theme for Items API (the player).

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/toggleTimer
list.description: Allows end users to click and show/hide the assessment timer. This is an accommodations tool.

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/toggleTimer~toggle
list.description: Toggle visibility without cloning nodes. CSS does the heavy lifting via .lt--timer-hidden

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/whiteNoise
list.description:
Renders an audio player that the end-user can use to play white noise sounds. Helps for some users with focus and concentration.

By default the player renders inside a custom dialog from Items API. This is the simplest set up, just call run() and add something like the following to your Items API config object (the essential piece is the custom button):

{
    "config": {
        "regions": "main",
        "region_overrides": {
            "right": [
                {
                    "type": "save_button"
                },
                {
                    "type": "fullscreen_button"
                },
                {
                    "type": "reviewscreen_button"
                },
                {
                    "type": "accessibility_button"
                },
                {
                    "type": "flagitem_button"
                },
                {
                    "type": "custom_button",
                    "options": {
                        "name": "btn-whitenoise",
                        "label": "White noise player",
                        "icon_class": "lt__whitenoise-player-icon"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "type": "masking_button"
                }
            ]
        }
    }
}

This will render a button in the vertical toolbar of the player with a headphones icon. Click this and the player will launch (see below).

If you want to render the player inside a custom element, pass an id to launchPlayer(id). This will render the player inside an element of your choice. You will be responsible for showing/hiding the player, or just leave it always visible.

<div id="player-wrapper"></div>
<div id="learnosity_assess"></div>

list.title: module:Extensions/Assessment/whiteNoise~launchPlayer
list.description: Launches the white noise audio player. Defaults to rendering inside an Items API custom dialog, in which case you never need to call this method directly.

list.title: module:Extensions/Authoring/contentTabs
list.description:
Extensions add specific functionality to Learnosity APIs. They rely on modules within LT being available.

--

Adds the ability for authors to add any number of tabs within a rich-text content block. This is achieved by leveraging custom buttons.

Each tab can be labelled. You can set content within each tab.

Important

The active tab (ie the tab that will be in focus) will be the one that the author last had focus on when they changed content and saved. You probably want that to be the first tab. If it's not, you need to edit the question, click the first tab inside the rich-text editor, make sure to change something even if it's adding a character and removing it, then save.

Adding a custom button is a capability in Author API. Below is a code snippet of an Author API configuration object. Note the custom button is added under rich_text_editor.

You MUST use the object as defined below. Also, note the toolbar_settings which is required to place the custom button(s) where you want in the toolbar.

{
    "config": {
        "dependencies": {
            "question_editor_api": {
                "init_options": {
                    "rich_text_editor": {
                        "customButtons": [
                            {
                                "func": "LT.extensions.contentTabs.addContentTabs",
                                "icon": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/michaelsharman/LT/refs/heads/main/src/authoring/extensions/ui/contentTabs/assets/images/icon_tabs.svg",
                                "label": "Add content tabs",
                                "name": "addContentTabs",
                                "attributes": ["content","stimulus","template"]
                            }
                        ],
                        "toolbar_settings": {
                            "ltr_toolbar": [
                                {
                                    "items": ["Bold","Italic","Underline","-","TextColor","-", "LrnUnderlinedIndicator","-","RemoveFormat","FontSize"],
                                    "name": "basicstyles"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["NumberedList","BulletedList","-","Indent","Outdent"],
                                    "name": "list"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["JustifyLeft","JustifyCenter","JustifyRight","JustifyBlock"],
                                    "name": "justify"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["Link","Unlink"],
                                    "name": "link"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["Image","LrnMath","Table","Blockquote","SpecialChar"],
                                    "name": "insert"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["LrnSimpleFeature"],
                                    "name": "simplefeature"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["LrnResource"],
                                    "name": "resource"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["LrnEditAriaLabel","LrnPopupContent"],
                                    "name": "editAriaLabel"
                                },
                                {
                                    "name": "custombuttons"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["Undo","Redo"],
                                    "name": "clipboard"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["Styles"],
                                    "name": "style"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["Sourcedialog"],
                                    "name": "mode"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["lrn_datatable"],
                                    "name": "data"
                                }
                            ]
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

list.title: module:Extensions/Authoring/contentTabs~addContentTabs
list.description: Called via a custom button in the rich text toolbar. Renders a modal asking the author how many tabs they want to add where the cursor is.

list.title: module:Extensions/Authoring/createTags
list.description:
Extensions add specific functionality to Learnosity APIs. They rely on modules within LT being available.

--

Adds the ability for authors to create tags (type:tag) via the Author API if they don't yet exist in the item bank.

list.title: module:Extensions/Authoring/dynamicContent
list.description:
Extensions add specific functionality to Learnosity APIs. They rely on modules within LT being available.

--

Adds an interactive table for users to author dynamic content. Users can also upload a file to populate the table, and export any data to work on it locally.

Supported file types for import: csv, xls, xlsx, ods, and txt.

list.title: module:Extensions/Authoring/essayMaxLength
list.description:
Extensions add specific functionality to Learnosity APIs. They rely on modules within LT being available.

--

Adds custom validation to ensure that only numbers are added to the max_length field for the listed types.

The extension will strip any invalid characters. Eg:

10.5

Will be changed to:

10

If the value contains leading zeros, the input field will be styled with a red border.

list.title: module:Extensions/Authoring/imageUploader
list.description:
Extensions add specific functionality to Learnosity APIs. They rely on modules within LT being available.

--

This extension replaces the default Learnosity image uploader with a custom image uploader that supports image editing and compression before uploading to the Learnosity CDN.

Consider this extension if you're looking to reduce the file size of images or if you want to give users the flexibility to crop or rotate them before uploading.

Supported mime types: image/gif, image/jpeg, image/png, image/svg+xml

.webp files are not supported by Learnosity, so we don't support them here.

Animated gifs become static.

By default, we resize images to a maximum width or height of 1500px. The calling page can override width, height, and quality. See below in run().

Image comparisons (before and after)

Click image to view full size.

Original Compressed File size reduction

205kB (2000x1589)
128kB (1500x1091)		 37.56%

480kB (2584x1518)
305kB (1500x881)		 36.46%

16.5mb (5102x2488)
155kB (1500x731) 		99.06%

11.9mb (5098x2480)
97kB (1500x729)		 99.18%

4.7mb (770x702)
50kB (770x702)		 98.94%

Exclusions

This extension doesn't run inside the simple features dialog. This mainly impacts posters for video files and background images for audio files.

list.title: module:Extensions/Authoring/languageTextDirection
list.description:
Extensions add specific functionality to Learnosity APIs. They rely on modules within LT being available.

--

Adds the ability for authors to add non-default language content by surrounding text with the lang attribute. Essential for screen readers. Also adds the ability for authors to add translate="no" around content. This is useful for content that should not be translated by Google translate or other translation services such as Learnosity Author Aide.

To remove an inline attribute, highlight the text and use the clear formatting button in the toolbar.

To remove a block attribute, choose "Remove Style" from the right-click menu.

Adding a custom button is a capability in Author API. Below is a code snippet of an Author API configuration object. Note the custom button is added under rich_text_editor.

You MUST use the object as defined below. Also, note the toolbar_settings which is required to place the custom button(s) where you want in the toolbar.

{
    "config": {
        "dependencies": {
            "question_editor_api": {
                "init_options": {
                    "rich_text_editor": {
                        "customButtons": [
                            {
                                "func": "LT.extensions.languageTextDirection.addLanguageAttribute",
                                "icon": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/michaelsharman/LT/refs/heads/main/src/authoring/extensions/ui/languageTextDirection/assets/icon_language.svg",
                                "label": "Set language",
                                "name": "addLanguageAttribute"
                            }
                        ],
                        "toolbar_settings": {
                            "ltr_toolbar": [
                                {
                                    "items": ["Bold","Italic","Underline","-","TextColor","-", "LrnUnderlinedIndicator","-","RemoveFormat","FontSize"],
                                    "name": "basicstyles"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["NumberedList","BulletedList","-","Indent","Outdent"],
                                    "name": "list"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["JustifyLeft","JustifyCenter","JustifyRight","JustifyBlock"],
                                    "name": "justify"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["Link","Unlink"],
                                    "name": "link"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["Image","LrnMath","Table","Blockquote","SpecialChar"],
                                    "name": "insert"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["LrnSimpleFeature"],
                                    "name": "simplefeature"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["LrnResource"],
                                    "name": "resource"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["LrnEditAriaLabel","LrnPopupContent"],
                                    "name": "editAriaLabel"
                                },
                                {
                                    "name": "custombuttons"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["Undo","Redo"],
                                    "name": "clipboard"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["Styles"],
                                    "name": "style"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["Sourcedialog"],
                                    "name": "mode"
                                },
                                {
                                    "items": ["lrn_datatable"],
                                    "name": "data"
                                }
                            ]
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

list.title: module:Extensions/Authoring/languageTextDirection~addLanguageAttribute
list.description: Called via a custom button in the rich text toolbar. Renders a modal asking the author to set inline or block. Then inserts a <span> element for inline or a <div> element for block with a translate attribute.

list.title: module:Extensions/Authoring/nativeTabs
list.description:
Extensions add specific functionality to Learnosity APIs. They rely on modules within LT being available.

--

Adds the ability for authors to add more native column tabs than is currently possible today in the Layout area.

list.title: module:Extensions/Authoring/renderPDF
list.description:
############ Incomplete - DO NOT USE

Extensions add specific functionality to Learnosity APIs. They rely on modules within LT being available.

--

Adds the ability for authors to choose whether uploaded (PDF) resources should be rendered to the learner on the front-end.

list.title: module:Extensions/Authoring/requiredTags
list.description:
Extensions add specific functionality to Learnosity APIs. They rely on modules within LT being available.

--

Validates that all required tags are present before publishing an item.

list.title: module:Extensions/Authoring/singleQuestion
list.description:
Extensions add specific functionality to Learnosity APIs. They rely on modules within LT being available.

--

Restricts authors to add only one question to an item. Allows multiple features to be added to the item, but only one question.

If you want any features, they must be added first.
